intro: Funastrum dumetorum, commonly known as the common rocknettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves with a hairy surface. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters, typically blooming from late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Funastrum dumetorum is often found in temperate regions of North America and parts of Europe.
